unnormalised: Delhi reports surge in dengue cases: Health officials are urging residents to take precautions as the city sees a sharp rise in dengue fever cases. As of 10/11/2024, a total of 500+ cases have been reported across the city, with the highest concentration in South Delhi (150 cases) and East Delhi (120 cases). This is significantly higher than the 300 cases reported in the same period last year. Experts are attributing the rise to stagnant water accumulation post-monsoon.
normalised: delhi reports surge in dengue cases: health officials are urging residents to take precautions as the city sees a sharp rise in dengue fever cases. as of tenth november two thousand and twenty four, a total of five hundred plus cases have been reported across the city, with the highest concentration in south delhi (one hundred and fifty cases) and east delhi (one hundred and twenty cases). this is significantly higher than the three hundred cases reported in the same period last year. experts are attributing the rise to stagnant water accumulation post-monsoon.

unnormalised: The Health Minister, Mr. Satyendar Jain, has called for increased fogging and public awareness campaigns. "We need everyone to play their part in preventing the spread of dengue. Please ensure there's no standing water in your homes or neighbourhoods," he urged. The govt. is also distributing pamphlets with info on dengue prevention. Apollo Hospital & AIIMS Delhi are seeing a surge in patients with symptoms like high fever (102Â°F+), body ache, and joint pain.
normalised: the health minister, mister satyendar jain, has called for increased fogging and public awareness campaigns. "we need everyone to play their part in preventing the spread of dengue. please ensure there's no standing water in your homes or neighbourhoods," he urged. the government is also distributing pamphlets with info on dengue prevention. apollo hospital and A-I-I-M-S delhi are seeing a surge in patients with symptoms like high fever (one hundred and two degree fahrenheit plus), body ache, and joint pain.

unnormalised: Remember friends, prevention is better than cure. Keep your surroundings clean & use mosquito repellent. If you experience any symptoms, consult Dr. Sharma or your family doctor ASAP! Don't self-medicate; a dengue diagnosis needs a proper blood test. The health department helpline number is 1075.
normalised: remember friends, prevention is better than cure. keep your surroundings clean and use mosquito repellent. if you experience any symptoms, consult doctor sharma or your family doctor as soon as possible! don't self-medicate; a dengue diagnosis needs a proper blood test. the health department helpline number is one zero seven five.
